comments:
Build ID: M20071023-1652

Steps To Reproduce:
When I start eclipse, I see the outline of the last selected 
file. 

When I switch to another file the outline menu says only pending and I get an exception on the console.

When I restart eclipse I get the outline for the now other file but when I switch to the first file I get an exception.

Hence, there is only outline for the C++ file, that was active when I start eclipse.

Fabian, please rebuild the index, this should solve the problem.

Looks like the problem is related to the fix for bug 208558. Andrew, are the index versions really compatible?

> Looks like the problem is related to the fix for bug 208558. Andrew, are the
> index versions really compatible?

I believe so - just to be sure I've retested with PDOMs from 4.0.0/4.0.1 in 4.0.2, and the macros were correctly handled. I currently can't see how the above exception would be thrown.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Fabian, please rebuild the index, this should solve the problem.
Thank you, that seems to have solved the problem!

(In reply to comment #2)
> > Looks like the problem is related to the fix for bug 208558. Andrew, are the
> > index versions really compatible?
> I believe so - just to be sure I've retested with PDOMs from 4.0.0/4.0.1 in
> 4.0.2, and the macros were correctly handled. I currently can't see how the
> above exception would be thrown.

Andrew, I have reviewed your fix. The change is not entirely compatible:
When using a pdom with version < 39:
* It is probably safe that the PDOMMacros write to the extra byte, because
  their size is not a multiple of 16.
* However it is unsafe to read this byte, because the malloc() method clears
  only the area that was requested and not the area that is actually reserved.

I assume that you are testing this only with PDOMs that have been created by a
index rebuild operation. You will not see the problem then (the extra bytes will
be zeroed in this case).

You can fix this by following the pattern I used for PDOM version 37 and 38, i.e. you need to store the information that it is safe to access the extra byte somewhere in the header chunk.

Created an attachment (id=84743)
proposed patch

thanks a lot Markus :)

I'm intending to apply the attached patch by Tuesday. I've followed your suggestion and added a regression test.

patch applied to cdt 4_0
